verses.verse: (Song of Trust and Security in God) A Miktam of David. (Ps 7.1; 17.8) Protect me, O God, for in you I take refuge.
I say to the LORD, “You are my Lord; I have no good apart from you.” (Jerome Tg: Meaning of Heb uncertain)
(Deut 33.3; Ps 101.6) As for the holy ones in the land, they are the noble ones in whom is all my delight.

(Ex 23.13; Ps 32.10; 106.37, 38) Those who choose another god multiply their sorrows; (Cn: Meaning of Heb uncertain) their drink offerings of blood I will not pour out or take their names upon my lips.
(Ps 23.5; 73.26; 125.3) The LORD is my chosen portion and my cup; you hold my lot.
(Ps 78.55; Jer 3.19) The boundary lines have fallen for me in pleasant places; I have a goodly heritage.
(Ps 73.24; 77.6) I bless the LORD, who gives me counsel; in the night also my heart instructs me.
(Ps 54.3; 62.2; 73.23) I keep the LORD always before me; because he is at my right hand, I shall not be moved.
(Ps 4.7, 8; 30.12) Therefore my heart is glad, and my soul rejoices; my body also rests secure.
(Ps 49.9; Acts 2.27; 13.35) For you do not give me up to Sheol or let your faithful one see the Pit.
(Ps 17.15; 36.7, 8; Mt 7.14) You show me the path of life. In your presence there is fullness of joy; in your right hand are pleasures forevermore.
